DGACM.relevance_comment: Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure adequate human oversight and appropriate quality control for multilingual online content generated through translation tools. DGACM (via the Office of the Under‑Secretary‑General and the Coordinator for Multilingualism hosted in the Department) is the Secretariat entity responsible for Secretariat‑wide multilingualism coordination and for overseeing quality of multilingual services (see PPB paras 2.3, 2.9 and subprogramme descriptions on documentation/technology). This SG request will be implemented operationally by DGACM units responsible for translation tools and multilingual quality control.

Requests the Secretariat to continue to provide procedural notes, statements and remarks for Presidents/Chairs in the United Nations official language spoken by the presiding officer. DGACM’s Subprogramme 1 provides procedural and technical secretariat support to the General Assembly and its committees (PPB paras 2.1(a), 2.20). This operative paragraph therefore imposes an operational obligation that DGACM implements through its procedural support services.

Requests the Secretary‑General to ensure that updates to the Procurement Manual are reflected in all six official language versions in an appropriate time frame. DGACM’s documentation and translation services (Subprogramme 3 and publishing services) are the Secretariat units that produce authoritative multilingual versions of official texts (PPB paras 2.1(c), 2.46–2.47). The SG direction will therefore be carried out in practice by DGACM translation/publishing teams.

Requests the Secretary‑General to implement the United Nations Strategic Framework on Multilingualism. DGACM houses the Coordinator for Multilingualism and is designated in the PPB as responsible for Secretariat‑wide coordination of multilingualism (PPB para 2.3) and for facilitating a coordinated approach (para 2.9). Implementation of the Framework will therefore be executed through DGACM functions.

Recognizes the need to strengthen the human resources capacity of the Office of the Coordinator for Multilingualism and requests the Secretary‑General to submit a proposal (including budget estimates). The paragraph directs resource/action on the Office that is located within DGACM (PPB para 2.3 references the Coordinator and Office of the Coordinator for Multilingualism). It therefore relates directly to DGACM’s staffing/capacity to carry out its mandated coordination role.

Requests the Secretary‑General to issue the relevant administrative and operational guidelines for implementation of the United Nations Strategic Framework on Multilingualism. Those operational guidelines will be implemented by the Coordinator for Multilingualism and Secretariat units; DGACM (hosting the Coordinator and responsible for Secretariat‑wide multilingual coordination per PPB para 2.3) will be a primary implementer of those guidelines.

Requests the Coordinator for Multilingualism and all Secretariat entities to contribute to implementation of the Framework. This is a direct instruction to the Coordinator for Multilingualism (the office located within DGACM) to take an active implementation role, matching DGACM’s stated responsibility to facilitate coordinated multilingualism across the Secretariat (PPB paras 2.3, 2.9).

Reiterates the request that the Secretary‑General complete the upload of important older United Nations documents to the UN website in all six official languages. DGACM’s documentation, meetings and publishing services (Subprogramme 3 and Subprogramme 4) are responsible for producing and issuing authoritative multilingual parliamentary/documentation products and for ensuring their availability online (PPB paras 2.1(c), 2.46–2.47, 2.59). The SG direction will therefore be operationalized by DGACM units.

Requests the Secretary‑General to continue to ensure, through provision of documentation services and meetings and publishing services under conference management (including high‑quality translation and interpretation), effective multilingual communication equally in all official languages among representatives of Member States and expert bodies. The paragraph explicitly references conference management services—DGACM’s core programme (PPB paras 2.1(a),(c); subprogrammes 3 and 4)—and thus constitutes a mandate that DGACM is the implementing service for.

Reiterates the request that the Secretary‑General ensure that rules concerning the simultaneous distribution of documents in all six official languages are strictly respected (printed copies and posting on the Official Document System/website). Ensuring simultaneous issuance is a central DGACM operational mandate (PPB paras 2.46–2.47, subprogramme 3 deliverables on simultaneous issuance), so this SG instruction will be carried out by DGACM documentation/publishing services.

Recognizes the contribution of the Language and Communications Training Unit and requests the Secretary‑General to ensure full implementation of the existing mandate on linguistic training. DGACM’s PPB describes learning, training and capacity‑building measures for documentation and language staff (see PPB paras 2.54–2.56 on learning and knowledge management, and subprogramme references to training in 2.46(b) and elsewhere). The SG request therefore relates to activities that DGACM and its language training functions deliver.
